intro: Tapeinostemon, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, often pale blue or purple flowers. The plant has hairy, sprawling stems and heart-shaped leaves that are adapted to conserve water. It blooms in the early morning, hence its common name, and is often found in dry, sandy soils. Tapeinostemon is a hardy species that thrives in full sun and is well-suited to xeriscaping.
